alert.note: Alert for Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor (Vermont) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Burlington (Northern Vermont and New York)
info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 10 at 2:24PM EST until December 11 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Burlington
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH MONDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by rain and snowmelt continues to be possible. * WHERE...Rutland and Windsor Counties in southern Vermont. * WHEN...Through Monday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Excessive runoff may result in flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations. Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - The River Forecast Center latest forecast has the Otter Creek at Center Rutland just reaching minor flood stage on Monday morning. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.

area.areaDesc: Eastern Rutland; Eastern Windsor; Western Rutland; Western Windsor
